content.protection: Nuts and medium and small cams
content.location: To the left of cam shaft

content.description: Primitive Man is a fun climb on the far right side of primitive buttress starts about 5 feet right of Failing Fingers and goes straight up the arête the crux is just past the middle where a couple strenuous moves come into play
content.protection: Can be a lead with small gear or can share set up with failing fingers and get both done.
content.location: far right arête of primitive buttress

content.description: Five feet right of Death Scream, go straight up. Once you get to the roofs go right rather than left as for Death Scream. The crux is here and the holds can be hard to find. Make some big moves here and then higher onto lichen.
content.protection: Standard TR set up, same anchors as Death Scream.

content.description: Just to the right of the arete, begin with a fun little double dyno to get off the ground (very easy but fun.)  From there make some face moves on small holds and work your way up to some cool underclings and blocky features (unfortunately, a few of these features wobble a bit).  Continue on thin face moves to the top.  Needs more traffic or a brush to clean up all the lichen and spiderwebs.
content.protection:
Top-rope anchor is not straightforward on this one if you want the anchor exactly above the climb.  Using some cracks at the top of Death Scream (the actual face) may be helpful. 

  Top-roping recommended, but as always it may be possible to lead if you're determined.

content.description: Fun climb follow a crack up and left of the roof then move straight up. Around the corner from death scream
content.location: Climb around the corner from death scream

content.description: A fun stemming corner with small holds and a slight overhang that still remains at the guidebook rating of 5.5.  The face on the right side is unfortunately home to quite a bit of lichen.  Looks harder than 5.5 at first glance.
content.protection:
Cracks close to the edge at the top for TR anchor.  Can be top roped off the same anchor as Huff and Puff. 

  Maybe leadable with a standard rack with an emphasis on larger stuff.

content.description: A really fun but short face climb on a slightly overhanging face.  Limit yourself to the face left of the big crack in the corner.  The holds and crimps are fairly large, but don't hang around too long due to the somewhat steep/pumpy climbing.
content.protection:
Cracks close to the edge at the top will take pro for your anchor.  Can be top roped off the same anchor as Hot Flash. 

  This would likely be a poor lead but you may be able to find something.  Most likely a face climb to be top roped.
content.location: The face to the climber's right of the triangular roof (left of the triangular roof is Cam Shaft.)

content.description: Start in the dihedral under a few mini overhangs is consistent 5.9 climbing on good holds
content.protection: nuts and small cams could lead c3s or aliens or easy top rope set up set of nuts for a vertical crack at top
content.location: Failing Fingers is on the right side of primitive buttress very fun climb

content.description: Evolution goes directly up the arête through small roof the crux is going past the roof
content.protection: standard blue mounds top rope set up good crack to plug gear
content.location: evolution is the route next to old world monkey goes directly up arête

content.description: Straight up the center of the face until reaching the huge roof. Enter the roof using decent holds and surmount it with a mantle-y thing. Feet are mostly minimal and poor through the crux. I have not seen it climbed gracefully.
content.protection:
Standard TR set up. There is a vertical crack ~10' back from the edge which may be useful.

 Leading would be quite a feat and possibly a bad idea but placements may exist.
content.location: Right up the center of the face, then up and left through the roof.

content.description: Follow the crack through the roof and find some solid jams and some stemming.  Hit a jug after making a few awkward moves and you'll soon find yourself at the top.  If it was longer it might get more stars.
content.protection:
Find some cracks not too far back from the edge in the 2-4" range for your anchor, or go super far back to use a big tree (very long slings required.) 

  A standard rack could protect this climb well on lead.
content.location: Up the crack with the triangular roof on the right side of it.  Roughly ten meters north of Death Scream.

content.description: Begin making face moves on thin but somewhat positive crimps up the improbable-looking face. Find some cool underclings somewhere around half way up and rest there. Use a thin shallow seam and possibly a couple layback moves to the top.  Needs traffic or brushing to clear out all the lichen.
content.protection:
Top rope anchor can use the same crack as for Death Scream (0.5" to 3"). 

  Top-roping is recommended, but a lead or headpoint may be possible.
content.location: A few feet right of Missing Link

content.description: Previously known as Agony Buttress, Primitive Buttress lies back in the woods and has a bunch of additions to it in the new 2012 Farris guidebook.  Grades range from easy all the way to 5.11.  It is well shaded when the trees have leaves on them and it doesn't see tons of traffic.
